query.description: Object that contains the information of a glycan query. Each piece of information in the query is optional however one piece must be present for a meaning full search. In later versions it will be possible to combine query objects using logical operations (AND, OR, NOT).

operation.description: his fields defines how the different parts/searches of the query are combined. Possible values are AND and OR. The default will be AND.

query_type.description: This field is set if a search by glycan type (e.g. N-Glycan) will be performed. The complete list of glycan types is maintained by the glygen server.

mass_type.description: This field is set if a search by glycan mass is performed. Possible values are Native and Permethylated. The default will be Native.

mass.description: This objects is specified if a search by glycan mass is performed. The search query consists of a minimum mass (glycan has to have equal or larger mass) and a maximum mass (glycan has to have equal or smaller mass). That way it defines an mass range to be searched.

min.description: Minimum value of the mass range.

max.description: Maximum value of the mass range.

number_monosaccharides.description: This objects is specified if a search by number of monosaccharides is performed. The search query consists of a minimum and a maximum value. That way it defines an range to be searched.

glycan_type.description: This field is set if a search by glycan type (e.g. N-Glycan) will be performed. The complete list of glycan types is maintained by the glygen server.

glycan_subtype.description: This field is set if a search by glycan subtype (e.g. bisection) will be performed. The complete list of glycan subtypes is maintained by the glygen server. This field can be used intependendly from g

organism.description: This field is set if a search by organism (e.g. human) is performed. The value can either be a scientific species name (NCBI Taxonomy), a synonym or a NCBI Taxonomy ID.

protein_identifier.description: This field is set if a search for glycans attached to a both gene_name and protein accession. The input is a Uniprot protein ID and gene name

glycan_motif.description: This field is set if a search by glycan motif is performed (e.g. LewisX). All structures containing this motif will be found.

glytoucan_ac.description: This field is set if a search by glycan ID is performed. Either an intact ID or part of an ID can be specified. The intact ID will lead to a single result while a partical ID might lead to many result

enzyme.description: This field is set if a search for glycans synthesised by a certain enzyme is performed. The input is an object that consists of an ID and a type.

id.description: ID of the enzyme this can either be a Uniprot ID (type=protein) or a gene name (type=gene).

type.description: Type of the enzyme input. This can either be a gene or a protein
